DOC.brief_title: Thoracic Ultrasonography Pulmonary Edema Patients With Pre-Eclampsia
DOC.detailed_description: This project compare use ultrasound chest detection fluid lung patient pre-eclampsia vs pregnant patient without pre-eclampsia . Patients admit obstetrical service recruit study enrollment . We divide patient two group . In study group , include patient pre-eclampsia without shortness breath , control group , include otherwise healthy pregnant patient . We exclude patient labor undergoing induction . Informed consent obtain patient enrol study . Study subject undergo ultrasound chest , perform member Emergency Medicine Ultrasound Division , experience perform lung ultrasound . Both hemithoraces divide 4 zone : anterior inferior , anterior superior , lateral inferior , lateral superior . Each zone assess presence B-lines . For zone consider `` positive '' pulmonary edema , minimum 3 B-lines . To diagnose patient pulmonary edema , least two zone hemithoraces must positive . The study investigator document presence B-lines particular zone data collection sheet . Brief representative video clip record zone . After complete sonographic examination , image transmit wirelessly ultrasound machine secure web base cloud ( Q-path ) subsequently interpret expert reviewer blind clinical information patient . They also document finding separate data collection sheet .
